text.section:
The Board may make an emergency award to the claimant before making a final decision in the case, if the Board determines, before taking action on the claim, that:
an award likely will be made on the claim; and
the claimant will suffer undue hardship unless immediate payment is made.

section.section:
The amount of an emergency award under this section:
may not exceed $2,000; and
shall be deducted from any final award made to the claimant.

Except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, a claimant shall repay the Board:
the excess of the amount of the emergency award over any final award; or
if a final award is not made, all of the emergency award.
On written request by a claimant, for a compelling reason the Board may waive the requirement that a claimant repay an emergency award under paragraph (2) of this subsection.
